mods.name: Netherite Plus
mods.description: Adds more netherite features to Minecraft.
mods.extendedDescription: Netherite is an amazing feature, but I felt that it was lacking some depth in Vanilla Minecraft, so I created this mod to add netherite features to all current tools. As of now, there are netherite equivalents for the elytra, bow, crossbow, anvil, fishing rod, trident, shulker boxes, horse armor, and shields. Some added features are fake netherite blocks for building, lava fishing with the netherite fishing rod, and xp reduction in the netherite anvil, which never breaks. All of these features are configurable and can be turned on and off. Netherite Plus is available for both Fabric and Forge

mods.name: Slime Block in Redstone Tab
mods.description: Reorginizes the creative inventory with configurable groups and items.
mods.extendedDescription: The creative inventory is extremely cluttered and needs updating. This client-side mod allows you to move any item or tag to any tab, and creating new tabs. There are two config files that can be dynamically changed and updated with the /reload command in Minecraft. Check Github for a more in depth explaination of the config files.

mods.name: Oro Config
mods.description: Simple JSON based config library with command and mod menu support
mods.extendedDescription: Simple JSON based config library with command and mod menu support

mods.name: Multi Item Lib
mods.description: Lightweight mod that expands hardcoded Minecraft items
mods.extendedDescription: A small library that easily allows for multiple types of items for Minecraft's more hardcoded items like elytra, fishing rods, bows, crossbows, and tridents. This library will be depricated once Fabric API includes better versions of this library.This library does not encompass all uses cases for item, but it does with most of them to make the items work with the players.

mods.name: Block Quantity Scanner
mods.description: Count how many blocks are at each y level
mods.extendedDescription: Count how many blocks are at each y level. Contains two  commands: `/scan_blocks <range> <block> [max-height]` and `/scan_all_ores <range>`

mods.name: Custom Item Range Combination
mods.description: Allows for the changing of how far item entities combine in Minecraft.
mods.extendedDescription: Allows for the changing of how far item entities combine in Minecraft. Optional client-side. I will not port this mod to forge. Should work on all Minecraft versions fabric works on. You can change the range by editing the config file: `custom_item_range_combination.json`, or running the command `/custom_item_range_combination range item_combine_range <range>`
